title: AI pulse coach reduces false alarms
summary: Our model now evaluates risky pressure and heart rate combinations before escalating to a human coach

content.text: The algorithm reviews each reading against two weeks of context including sleep, activity, and medication timing
When it detects sustained elevation it shares an action checklist with the member and pings a coach to join the conversation

items: Alerts trigger only after a confirmed risk
The journal records which advice was followed
Clinicians receive a concise briefing before the visit

content.text: In trials false positives dropped by 37 percent and members shared more data with their physicians

imageAlt: Illustration of sensors measuring pressure and pulse

title: Seasonal dishes arrive in photo nutrition
summary: We added 180 popular recipes so guidance stays precise whether it is winter soups or summer salads

content.text: The catalogue now recognises chilled okroshka, sorrel soup, persimmon desserts, and more meals that previously required manual entry
Recommendations adapt to the season: lighter meals and cooling drinks for summer, warming soups and vitamin D sources for winter
"Advice should sound specific, not like a generic article tip"
Accuracy on the validation set reached 92 percent and members logged 24 percent more meals

title: Study: guided care lowers hospitalisations
summary: Together with a clinical partner we evaluated how digital support affects admissions

content.text: We analysed 620 hypertension cases. Members using HlCoAi had fewer urgent admissions 12 percent versus 19 percent in the control group
Key drivers included timely risk alerts, collaborative medication reviews, and family support through shared access

items: Average response time to dangerous spikes dropped to 26 minutes
Physicians received more frequent progress updates
70 percent of members kept logging after the study ended

content.text: We plan to share anonymised findings with research partners interested in cardiology prevention
